p: Clinical trials that target the glucocerebrosidase ( GBA) pathway are probably in the most advanced stages towards precision medicine in PD. This is a result of the relatively high frequency of GBA mutations in PD and the availability of basic science data collected about GBA mutations from Gaucher disease research. GBA mutations are a common risk factor for PD and are present in 7â€“10% of PD patients worldwide. Among Ashkenazi Jews, around 20% of PD patients carry a GBA mutation [ 47]. A high prevalence has also been reported in the Netherlands, where 15.5% of PD patients carry a GBA mutation [ 48].
